name: WRITING SEMINAR IN HIST: AFRICA IN W. IMAGINATION

section.name: WRITING SEMINAR IN HIST: AFRICA IN W. IMAGINATION

values.comments:
This writing seminar focused on Philadelphia's history and the debates surrounding its preservation. As a writing seminar, it involved reading a variety of sources, visiting sites across the city, and writing short papers to develop essay organization. The course also featured a collaborative multimedia project about Philadelphia's landmarks.

The majority of students found this to be a worthwhile class that was “helpful in many ways.” Although there were a handful of complaints related to the writing seminar structure, the overwhelming majority praised this class and noticed their personal writing styles had become “more efficient and concise.” 

Students declared that Professor Lautin is an “excellent teacher” who offers “meaningful, valuable” feedback on assignments. Several students commented that Professor Lautin did a remarkable job “stimulating student interest” and appreciated her “energetic” teaching style.

Students felt that there was a substantial amount of work for the class and expressed an improvement in their writing ability over the course of the semester. This course fulfills the Writing requirement.
